sea.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the large area of salty water that covers much of the Earth’s surface
sea.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Jay stripped his clothes off and ran into the sea.
The sea came up to my knees.
Most exports went by sea  (=on a ship).
a little cottage by the sea  (=near the sea)
He spent over 30 years at sea  (=working on ships or boats on the sea).
They stood side by side looking out to sea  (=looking at the sea).
sea.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a large area of salty water that is mostly enclosed by land
sea.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: one of the broad areas that seem flat on the Moon and Mars
sea.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: blue
The sun shone brightly upon the clear blue sea.
The sea was perfectly calm.
The sea was too rough to swim in.
choppy
The wind was starting to pick up and the sea was becoming choppy.
The yachts bobbed around on the choppy sea.
heavy seas
The tanker split apart and sank in heavy seas.
a stormy sea
a picture of a battleship in a stormy sea
the open sea
Rescuers are trying to drive the stranded whales back out into the open sea.
the deep sea
The deep sea is the most unexplored area left on the planet.
cross the sea
Our ancestors crossed the sea in small boats.
go to sea
He went to sea when he was eighteen.
put to sea
The refugees put to sea in rickety rafts.
be lost at sea
His father had been lost at sea three months before.
be swept out to sea
They had to rescue three young canoeists who were swept out to sea.
sea + NOUN
sea water
Removing salt from sea water is an expensive process.
a sea view
All the bedrooms have a sea view.
sea level
Average sea levels are rising year on year.
the sea air
He breathed in the fresh sea air.
the sea bed
A lot of these small creatures feed on the sea bed.
sea.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with sea
You use in the sea to talk about things that happen in the water
Whales are mammals that live in the sea
You use on the sea to talk about things that happen on the surface of the water
The boat floated on the calm sea
You use by the sea to talk about things that are on the land near the sea
They live in a cottage by the sea
sea.translation[0].note_box[2].sections[: the sea
the large area of salty water that covers much of the Earth’s surface
She lives by the sea.
The sea was very rough.
the ocean
the large area of salty water that covers much of the Earth’s surface
a house by the ocean
The restaurant had a sweeping view of the ocean.
waters
a large area of water – used about an area of water that belongs to a particular country, or when describing what the water is like
boats fishing in Canadian waters
British territorial waters
the calm waters of the harbour
dangerous waters
choppy waters  (=with a lot of waves)
bay
an area of sea that is partly enclosed by a curve in the land
I swam across the bay.
the Bay of Biscay
gulf
a very large area of sea partly enclosed by land
the Gulf of Mexico
oil from the Gulf  (=the area of water near Iran, Saudi Arabia etc)
tide
the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea
Is the tide going out or coming in ?
High tide  (=when the sea is at its highest level)is at 4 o'clock in the afternoon.
low tide  (=when the sea is at its lowest level)
The rocks are visible at low tide.
wave
a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea
The waves were crashing against the rocks.
